aboutUsItem1Caption.en:
Miles of Good is a campaign that will help you gain donors and receive funding for achieving your goals.

Miles of Good operates basing on the cooperation of organisations and active workers from around the world. We are building a coalition that has a stronger chance of reaching potential donors and the media. The campaign teaches values such as responsibility, partnership (organisations finance it with their own resources) and good management. It also promotes organisations that function in an effective an ethical way by aiding them financially.

The involved organisations raise money for various social goals: education, security, ecology, sport, culture, humanitarian relief, churches, the disabled and health.

aboutUsItem2Caption.en:
Additionally, Miles of Good is a comfortable way of raising money because:

  • every organisation works for their own goals
  • the funds go directly to each organisation, they are never in one account


This year's campaign will begin on the 1st of March and end on the 4th of June 2017. For 3 months, cooperation organisations will be raising money with all the available methods: through rallies at schools, parishes as well as through our website and other auctions and concerts. The campaign is accompanied by an attempt to beat the Guinness world record.

The competition consists of assembling rows of coins of the same denomination - that's why the campaign is named Miles of Good. The coins are being glued to rows of tape, creating one meter sections (this facilitation was invented a few years ago by the Filipinos). To beat the record we need almost 47 miles.

The coing for creating the sections is chosen in agreement with the first organisation that enters the campaign for each country.

aboutUsItem3Caption.en:
For each organisation that applies to enter the campaign, we offer:

  • providing a website for the campaign with a subpage dedicated to your organisation,
  • providing a system of international online payments,
  • creating the design of promotional materials,
  • creating the design of graphics to use online,
  • translations of documents and promotional materials,
  • helpdesk in English,
  • promoting the campaign on social media,
  • a fundraising know-how from various countries around the world.


The campaign is financed from the recruitment fees payed separately by each organisation. The fee is decided taking into consideration the financial situation of the country, basing on PKB per Capita calculated by the International Monetary Fund.
